title: How to Prevent Windows 10 from Going to Sleep

steps.title: Open the Settings app
steps.content: Open the Settings app . Click the Start button in the lower-left corner of your screen and select the settings gear .

steps.title: Open the System category.
steps.content: Open the System category. It's the first category to the very left of the app.

steps.title: Select Power and sleep from the left pane.
steps.content: Select Power and sleep from the left pane. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Disable sleep.
steps.content: Disable sleep. Set both of the drop down menus under "Sleep" to "Never".

steps.title: Open the Control Panel.
steps.content: Open the Control Panel. You can do this by right-clicking the Start button, and then clicking on "control panel" in the context menu that comes up. You can also open the control panel by pressing ⊞ Win + X at the same time.

steps.title: Open Power Options.
steps.content: Open Power Options. It will be under the "System and Security" header. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click on the link ‘Choose when to turn off the display‘ from the left pane of the window screen.
steps.content: Click on the link ‘Choose when to turn off the display‘ from the left pane of the window screen.

steps.title: Set both the drop down menus next to "Sleep" to Never.
steps.content: Set both the drop down menus next to "Sleep" to Never. Make sure to save the changes before closing the window.
